headline: Homemade Lasagna
description: This mom's homemade lasagna is a family favorite. The recipe pairs a meaty, from-scratch tomato sauce with a cheesy filling and lots of mozzarella on top.

video.description: See how to make a meaty lasagna completely from scratch.
video.name: Homemade Lasagna

name: Homemade Lasagna

recipeInstructions.text: Combine pork and ground beef in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato sauce, 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, garlic, basil, salt, oregano, and sugar. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes.

While the sauce is simmering, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook lasagna noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and set aside.
While the noodles are cooking, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Mix cottage cheese, Parmesan cheese, eggs, remaining 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until combined.

Assemble lasagna: Spread a spoon or two of sauce over the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish just to to coat it. Place two layers of noodles over the sauce to cover. Layer with 1/2 of the cheese mixture, 1/2 of the remaining sauce, and 1/2 of the mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers once more using the remaining noodles, cheese mixture, sauce, and mozzarella. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes. Remove the foil and bake until cheese is golden brown, 5 to 10 more minutes.
Remove from the oven and let stand for 10 minutes before cutting and serving.

review.reviewBody: Everybody loved it! The alterations I made, because I didn‚Äôt have quite enough cottage cheese was adding mozzarella pearls to the cottage cheese mixture. Made it so melty! I also only added about a half a teaspoon of salt. I can my own Italian tomato mix and then to thicken the sauce up a little bit I used a can of tomato paste. We all like the noodles to be a little firmer, so I don‚Äôt pre-cook them.

We loved the mild flavor and texture. I did not use the eggs and I used grass fed ground beef. I also used ricotta cheese and added sauteed mushrooms and spinach into the layers. I used extra garlic and extra of all the herbs and no salt whatsoever. I also do not eat processed sugar, so I shredded a carrot into the sauce. Yum!
Good lasagna but much too salty. I doesn't even add the salt to the cheese mixture and it was still too salty. Be cautious. I used dried parsley instead of fresh as well.

I substituted ground turkey for the pork, lower in fat for pancreatitis .... Added spinach .... Made my own lasagna noodles ..... (I love fresh made pasta) üòç .... This recipe was perfect. This photo was taken right before removing the foil cover & browning the cheese on top.
Great choice with using cottage cheese. I have always used it in everyone of my pans.
This my go to recipe.. it is always a hit and simply delicious.

Lasagna is a 2-day recipe for me: sauce is made on day 1, and recipe is finished, assembled, and baked the 2nd day. Sauce turned out very well, but I did adapt to our tastes a bit. Substituted a can of El Pato Hot Tomato Sauce (was a great addition and another layer of flavor), added a few fennel seeds, a glug of red wine, and bumped up the basil and oregano (all personal taste). I know, I know, I changed it, but lasagna is a lot of work, this was fairly expensive, and I didn‚Äôt want any flavor issues; I know our taste preferences. When boiling your noodles, count out 12, don‚Äôt add the 16-oz box because I did so, and ended up throwing away 7 noodles which weren‚Äôt needed. Could be the cottage cheese has a bit more moisture than ricotta, but I used it, and although it tasted really good, it took longer to bake than the timing in the recipe. I‚Äôm happy with the way this turned out, but I must say that I still prefer Italian sausage over ground pork.
Way, way too much salt and I didn't use as much as the recipe called for, it ruined the whole dish.
Great tasty lasagna. My family loved it.
It was most helpful and I learned a lot from it.

Loved the lasagna but I didn't use the eggs. I also soaked the noodles in hot water for 20 minutes and they were cooked through perfectly. I added additional seasoning to the sauce and extra fresh basil.
This turned out great! I substituted medium hot salsa for tomato sauce, and Italiano four cheese for parmesan. I was very happy with the result.
One of the absolute best lasagna recipes I have came across by far. The only thing I do differently really is instead of sausage I use 2lbs hamburger meat. My family loves this recipe.
Came out great
bland no flavor.
this turned out so good and easy to make
I used the recipe as a guide and had to change a lot of things because I didn't have all the ingredients. It was great in spite of it all!
It's delish!
It was pretty good .. I added alil something extra but we loved it

My family loved this recipe, but it turned out pretty salty. Next time I will cut the salt back a lot. It may not even need any at all. Though it was a bit salty, it‚Äôs worth making again and I definitely will!
This was awesome this was the first lasagna I made all by myself without help.
This is the best sauce I have ever made. Thanks Craig!
This is always one of our favorites
Boss recipe. Used ricotta and spicy italian sausage instead of pork, and it turned out insanely good!!!
Amazingly good

Will definitely make again. First time making lasagna with cottage cheese; I used hosta, horseradish, and beet leaves for the veggies. I cut back on the salt & put sauce on bottom first, as recommended; used a jar of pasta sauce with the crushed tomatoes; and added a bit more sugar (to off set the bitter horseradish leaves). It came out great. :)
Such a great recipe! Used ricotta instead of cottage cheese as it‚Äôs what I had on hand. Next time I‚Äôll try cottage cheese to compare.
Used it as a base recipe. Turned out pretty tasty. Could have possible used a few more minutes in the oven.
Yes use my own chesees and sauce and most def will make again??????
Delicious

I used ground beef and Hot Italian Johnsonville sausages, topped the lasagne with Parm when I took the foil off. Also added about 8 oz drained frozen spinach to the ricotta/egg/parm mix. Otherwise, with the other additions I made, this is my go to lasagne recipe now. I would probably add a bit more cheese as well, but this was good!

A keeper for sure! However, I am a self professed salt-aholic and I would use less than the recipe calls for. I didn't use but 12 of the noodles with my two layers so ended up throwing the rest out. I sprinkled about 1/2 cup of parmesan cheese on the top for the last 10 minutes and then broiled it about 2 minutes. I thought this was an excellent recipe!
I have made this multiple times. Of course, I make my own small adjustments but the base of the recipe is the same. Very good and would recommend!
FANTASTIC.. 1st time ever making lasagna and it was FABULOUS
I did not put pork in it. Came out real good. Will make over and over. It is better than a recipe that I have been making for years.
Do yourself a favor. Do not use cottage cheese (use ricotta cheese instead) and do not use any of the salt recommended in this recipe. The dish comes out way too salty (and I'm a salt lover).
Added some extra sauce really juicy

Good base sauce! Better with added mushrooms, red wine, bay leaf and much more seasonings. I used ground pork and pork sausage (it's what I had on hand) so I added a bit of beef stock concentrate. 
Love the cottage cheese with mixture!
I love this recipe
Yes, I added Italian Seasoning, a little more garlic
I would of course make another batch! My kids, nieces, cousins and sister LOVED it!!!!
LOVED IT!
Very good but needs more cheese

I made it, it is delicious! My only question is that several ingredients were listed twice in the prep section, once in the meat and again in the cottage cheese/Parmesan mix. I‚Äôve been putting the spices in the meat sauce and it turns out fantastic, a family hit!

I made this as the recipe states, but used Ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese. I just dont like cottage cheese in Lasagna. The dish is the most delicious Lasagna Ive made. I love the sauce as its perfectly seasoned. It is my go to recipe now. I also use the sauce on pasta & make meatballs for a great pasta sauce. Make a fresh salad & garlic bread & you have dinner with home made sauce.
Delicious. I loved it. I‚Äôd make it again
I did the ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese, used italian sausage rather that the pork. It turned out wonderful and very tastsy!
Used a little more sauce than suggested but it came out great! Now my wife calls me Mama Al! Not bad for the first time.

Nailed it! It was delicious, don‚Äôt get discouraged by the reviews, I only added an extra layer of cheese on top with some Parmesan mixed in. Ricotta is not my favorite so I really enjoyed the cottage cheese version! I added an extra layer of cheese on top and some extra Parmesan mixed with the mozzarella. I also used a whole pound of mild Italian sausage instead of 1/2 beef and 1/2 pork. Really didn‚Äôt have a salt problem but I improvised and added as much as I felt necessary. Plus I love salt. It was delicious, don‚Äôt get
I loved it. I will make it again. Gave some to my friend and she said it was delicious. Froze some for another dinner for my family.

I make this a few times a year. And I use the sauce for my chicken parm when I make that. Will definitely be the only lasagna recipe I ever use again. The family LOVES it. I do substitute ricotta for the cottage cheese.
simple and delicious.

I made it exact besides used 1lb of beef and 1lb 1/2 of pork and it seriously was out of this world! My husbands grandmother has never tried lasagna because she said it never caught her eye in restaurants and she told me 100 times how good it was and went for seconds!
First time making lasagna from scratch. This recipe is on point! Wife said it was the best she'd ever had!

I don‚Äôt understand why, they didn‚Äôt include how much salt, parsley, and pepper should I put in the cheese mixture and in the sauce mixture. It would have been better if they indicate it there. (The separation) I put all the salt, pepper, parsley all at thesame time in the sauce mixture and later didn‚Äôt realize I have to put thesame thing on the cheese mixture. Made me so confused and frustrated for a first timer like me.

It was my first lasagna. I followed every step. My husband loves lasagna and he said that his mother‚Äôs is the best he‚Äôs ever tried so I kept my expectations low until his first bite. He finally said this is the best lasagna he has ever tried and I‚Äôm just speechless.

I most definitely will make this again. The best lasagna I've ever had. The only tweaks I did were to NOT add the salt (the hubby and I use little or no salt and figured we'd get enough from the ingredients... and we did!), added a bit of pepper flakes and used oven ready lasagna noodles. We loved it and I even passed the recipe along to friends on FB. Bravo on a great recipe and thanks for sharing it!

I made this recipe last night and it turned out fabulous. I did increase the meats and sauce a little for the slightly larger pan size but everyone love it. served with garlic toast and green beans for a side. Amazing Friday night dinner! Thank you!
A simple recipe. A great result!

I always read the comments for extra tips before I make things, so here are mine. I used ground turkey and ground chicken instead of beef and pork since my fam and I don't eat those. I used ricotta instead of cottage cheese and doubled the amount. I also went for double the amount of shredded cheese but used Provel instead of Mozzarella to do so. My family loved it! Will definitely be making again.
This is the most amazing lasagna I have ever made! I made this for my boyfriend and he proposed that night. He said the lasagna sealed the deal!
No changes and yes I‚Äôd make it again ! Delicious
This is one of my favorite recipes! I added some ricotta, and doubled the tomato sauce and crushed tomatoes. I like my lasagna with alot of red sauce to match the amount of cheese. Perfect mixture!

Good but did not like the double layers of noodles and did not use salt in cheese mixture (a total of 3 1/2 tsp sounded like too much). I found there was enough sauce and liked the pork/beef mixture. Think it could use a little more cheese but that is because I am a cheese lover. All in all though, a tasty lasagna that I will make again..

Next time I will not add the sausage. I used the no cook lasagna noodles. Cooking time was a little longer, but, worth it. Because of that I will double the tomato sauce to add more moisture during cooking going forward.

Family loved it and the instructions were perfect! I made it with Turkey vs. the beef and pork then drained and it still turned out so flavorful! I did add a tad more salt and mozzarella just because we love cheese!

I made this lasagna for my extended family one evening. It was an absolute hit. Everyone loved it, and there were no leftovers at all.

I did make a few changes: I left out the parsley because the kids are suspicious of random green bits, I used 2 cloves of garlic, and I added 1 tsp of ground cinnamon. 

Cinnamon is always my go to secret ingredient for all tomato sauces! It adds a warmth to the sauce and everyone always seems to love it and they're always surprised when they find out what it is. 

Thank you for this recipe! I will be making it again.

I like a hint of nutmeg and added to the sauce and to the cheese mixture. I don't measure a single I should.. but probably 1/8th tsp to the sauce and just a few dashes to the cheese mixture. It is a matter of personal taste.

Wow, waaaaaay too salty! All I tasted was salt and onion. Should have either sauteed the garlic and onion with the meat or used minced DRIED onion. I would have left out all but maybe a 1/2 tsp of salt. The dish was completely ruined after all my effort and I took maybe 4 bites and couldn't stand it anymore.

I like the simplicity of the recipe, they differ from mine as I like flavor and I love to do wine paring. but so people know Ive not an ego, I would blend 1lb Italian sausage with beef.
use crushed garlic instead of powder, and Monterey jack {pepper jack} if you want a kick, Kolby, mozzarella, and fresh graded parmesan in all applications, specially on the surface and serving.
I also add fresh baby spinach to the cottage cheese mixture level, as well as sliced baby bell mushrooms, and more crushed garlic. 
 serve with a pinot noir, I prefer my own but a Columbia crest is very well suited or an Australian $20+ bottle with a classic Cesar Italian salad is a very good combo
I also offer an Italian classic cyanate that would be divine when this is served with fresh roasted asparagus
Excellent but it was a little runny. I drained one can of tomatoes into the bottom of the dish as suggested and I should have drained the second one. The taste was great though.
Very delicious basic lasagna recipe, I would maybe add a little more cottage cheese.

It was a labor of love but all lasagna is. I picked this one because I don't like ricotta. Yummy but holy salt, Batman! Next time we are for sure going to cut out most of the salt. I'll keep it in the sauce but there's no reason to put it in the egg/cheese mixture.
This is the best lasagna I have ever made. The homemade sauce makes the dish. However I do not use as many eggs as the recipe calls for. Everyone should try it once
This was my first attempt making a lasagna, and according to my fiance' - I knocked it out of the park! Her 21 year old daughter devoured it as well. Great recipe!
Doubled up on the meat but otherwise no changes. My youngest hates lasagna and even he admitted that it was good!
I didn't change a thing, next time though I will make 1 1/2 times the sauce..delicious.

I made this for my husband's belated birthday dinner, his mom and brother joined us. His mom was a chef in her younger days so is a hard person to cook for and she loved it - she even had seconds! The only thing was it was a bit too salty. Other than that it was absolutely fantastic!
My family love this when I make it. My wife and mother in law always used to make their lasagna but since I made this I now always have to make it. Lol

This is a very good recipe. The only made a few small changes. Like other reviewers, I doubled the tomato sauce and crushed tomatoes. I reserved about 1/2 cup of the extra sauce. I used mild Italian sausage instead of pork. I also reduced the amount of salt by half but it seemed a little under seasoned once reduced. Overall this is a good recipe and I will make it again. Thanks for posting this!

This Lasagna recipe is the greatest! 
I've made it three times now for family get-together's and everyone loves it. 
One question. It does not mention how much parsley to add to the cheese mixture. How much should I use?

I used to make homemade lasagna until I found a recipe for lasagna made with jarred spaghetti sauce about 20 years ago, then that's all I made. I wanted to make the old fashioned lasagna sauce again, so I gave this recipe a try. I was not disappointed! It tasted exactly as I remembered. I made this recipe exactly as written, I just added pepper to the sauce, and I used ricotta instead of cottage cheese and only 1 egg instead of 2. I will be using this recipe! It's a winner, and it's not that much harder than using spaghetti sauce.

My fianc√©e and I love this recipe. He would disagree with me but the only change I would make is not adding the salt to the cheese mixture. I don't eat a lot of salt so to me it was to salty. However, my fianc√©e thought it was perfect. Other than that small change I loved it. I will make it again. Oh I did add the extra sauce to the bottom of the dish like others suggested BEFORE the first layer of noodles and that made a huge difference. Noodles were not dry at all.
made no changes everything was great will use again
Actually quite easy to make for someone who has never made lasagna before. I used ricotta instead of cottage cheese and added spinach. Everyone loved it, definitely will make it again.

I agree with those who say this does not make enough sauce. Next time I will make 1.5 times as much sauce. And I used ricotta instead of cottage cheese. And no need to add salt to the ricotta if you are adding Parmesan! Tarragon instead of parsley in the ricotta adds a delicious flavor dimension.
Made it ricotta cheese. I found it very tasty, all I would suggest would be more sauce otherwise very delish!

Best lasagna I've ever made. I loosely followed the recipe...3/4 lb 90% lean beef, 1 mild italian sausage, added onions and olive oil before cooking the meat, used ricotta rather than cottage cheese, added some fresh oregano and basil to the sauce, and replaced the sugar with a few grains of cardamom (like 10) which give a sweet taste without the sugar, and made fresh pasta instead of boxed. Using fresh pasta I researched whether to cook it or not before putting it in the oven and opted not to. I think that was a good choice, it kept the layers from being too runny and slippery when served. Everyone LOVED it.

This is very similar to my long time recipe. I also use cottage cheese rather than ricotta cheese and everyone has commented on how much creamier and moister it is. Ricotta is a much drier cheese. The only thing I did differently is I used 3 cups cottage cheese and 12 ounces of tomato paste rather than the sauce. Turned out great!

It was not a really special recipe, kind of tasted like all of the other ones I have made. The meat mixture doesn't need to be simmered for 30 mns; 10 mns is long enough. My husband enjoyed it for dinner. However, I will end up making my other recipe I have.
Nothing special. It was good.

This is one of the best lasagna recipes I've tried and it's super easy. It worked very well with all dried ingredients and I had ground Italian sausage in stead of pork or beef but it still worked very well. My girls love it.

I chose this recipe because of the ground pork/beef combination and because it called for small curd cottage cheese. I omitted the salt and doubled the tomato sauce. Delicious. It is a classic meat and cheese lasagna that is easily adapted.
This recipe was delicious!! It doesn't say how much parsley to add to the cheese mix (only the sauce mix), so we did 1 tbs. We also did all beef instead of half pork. Great leftovers!

HOLY MOLY!!! This was AWESOME!!! I put spinach in the layers and it was amazingly good. I also added chopped mushrooms to the sauce. I somehow had leftover noodles, spinach & sauce and a full pan so I made lasagna rollups.

Delicious! I uses 1/2 ground sirloin and 1/2 hot Italian sausage with the full 15 oz. can of sauce. Also 1/2 ricotta and 1/2 cottage cheese, with no added salt in this part. I tossed a little chopped spinach in 2 layers as well. A little sauce on the bottom to prevent sticking and had 3 single layers.

I substituted 1 tsp. onion powder for the onion & only added salt & parsley to the sauce, not the cheese mixture. (The person posting did not say how much parsley to add to the cheese.) I also did not cook the noodles before assembling the lasagna. (Because I read in a recipe column that precooking lasagna noodles makes the lasagna more runny & less firm.) I will not be making this again; I don't know if I erred or I did not like the taste; normally I like lasagnas with cottage cheese. Also I discovered not precooking the noodles was a bad idea--the noodles were chewy.
Was hit with the family. I had enough to make an extra pan for the in-laws!
Was delicious and worth the hard work! Super cheesy and just steamy and delicious. My only word of advice would be to be generous with the spices and the tomato sauce.
